programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: Michael Crichton directed this adaptation of his novel chronicling the first robbery of a moving train in 1855.

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: Michael Crichton directed this adaptation of his novel chronicling the first robbery of a moving train in 1855.

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
programme.desc: A shady millionaire (Robert Redford) pines for another man's wife (Mia Farrow) amid the lavish parties and opulent mansions of 1920s Long Island.

programme.title: The Uninvited
programme.desc: A ghost prompts a lethal battle of wills between a man's new fiancee (Elizabeth Banks) and his two daughters (Emily Browning, Arielle Kebbel), one of whom has just returned from a mental ward.

programme.title: The Wasp
programme.desc: Two estranged friends unveil a dangerous and deceptive plot that forever changes their lives.

programme.title: Disturbia
programme.desc: Under house arrest, a troubled youth (Shia LaBeouf) is unsure if his neighbor (David Morse) is really a serial killer or if his suspicions are the result of a captive and overactive imagination.

programme.title: The Machinist
programme.desc: Cryptic notes and encounters with a mysterious stranger torment a drill-press operator (Christian Bale) who has not slept in a year.

programme.title: Virtuosity
programme.desc: An ex-cop doing prison time chases a virtual-reality killer from the program onto the Los Angeles streets.

programme.title: The Running Man
programme.desc: A police-state scapegoat (Arnold Schwarzenegger) must play a TV host's (Richard Dawson) deadly game show for the 21st-century masses.

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: A teen taps his computer into the NORAD missile-defense system and plays a video game, "Global Thermonuclear War.".

programme.title: Super 8
programme.desc: A series of unexplained events follows a horrifying train derailment, leading some young filmmakers (Elle Fanning, Joel Courtney) to suspect that the catastrophe was not an accident.

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: As a comet is on a collision course with earth, humans have to prepare for their survival. They randomly select eight hundred thousand people to be saved in order to keep the human race alive.

programme.desc: A police-state scapegoat (Arnold Schwarzenegger) must play a TV host's (Richard Dawson) deadly game show for the 21st-century masses.

programme.title: The Return of the Living Dead
programme.desc: Punk rockers, a cremator (Don Calfa) and medical-supply workers (Clu Gulager, James Karen) have a problem with zombies in Kentucky.

Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.
